title: params: ensure short description is only a single line

conversation.author: bkueng
conversation.body:
So a UI can display it properly

This is less relevant with xml, as QGC is currently showing as long single line, but for json parameter metadata, it messes up the UI.

issue_comments.author: dagar
issue_comments.body:
I'm also wondering if we should try to get the length under control.

Maybe cap it at the worst case today and gradually ratchet it up until we hit something reasonable?

issue_comments.author: bkueng
issue_comments.body:
Yup, I added a limit of 150 for existing and 70 to the yaml, so we can shorten when transitioning.

These are the worst cases:
```
80 Minimum landing target standard covariance, uses reported covariance if greater.
81 Airspeed sensor tube diameter. Only used for the Tube Pressure Drop Compensation.
81 Maximum absolute altitude (height above ground level) allowed for range aid mode.
81 Time in seconds we wait on reaching target heading at a waypoint if it is forced.
82 Enable yaw control of the mount. (Only affects multicopters and ROI mission items)
83 Boolean to allow moving into directions where there is no sensor data (outside FOV)
84 Maximum allowed angle the vehicle is allowed to pitch down to generate forward force

84 Terrain maximum percent grade, hilly/outdoor (100 = 45 deg), flat/Indoor (0 = 0 deg)

85 Maximum vertical velocity for which position hold is enabled (use 0 to disable check)
86 Enable publishing of a fake global position (e.g for AUTO missions using Optical Flow)

87 Maximum horizontal velocity for which position hold is enabled (use 0 to disable check)
89 Time-out to wait when offboard connection is lost before triggering offboard lost action.
90 Auxillary Velocity Estimate (e.g from a landing target) delay relative to IMU measurements
90 Enable PWM input on for engaging failsafe from an external automatic trigger system (ATS).
91 Optical Flow data will only be used if the sensor reports a quality metric >= EKF2_OF_QMIN.
92 Horizontal acceleration threshold used by automatic selection of magnetometer fusion method.
93 Tilt actuator control value commanded when disarmed and during the first second after arming.
93 Upper limit on airspeed along individual axes used to correct baro for position error effects
93 Z position of IMU in body frame (down axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)
```
